plan: Start with moderate bids around half your value to gather data on competitors' strategies. Gradually increase bids when your value is high, testing aggressive bids near your value to assess opponents' risk tolerance. Occasionally, place low bids to gauge the minimum winning bid threshold. Track patterns in Betty's and Charles's bids to adjust your strategy dynamically. If a consistent pattern emerges, exploit it by slightly undercutting their maximum bids. Prioritize learning their risk levels and adjust aggressiveness accordingly. Use this information to optimize bids, aiming for high-value wins at minimal costs over the 10 rounds.

In the initial rounds, I'll experiment with aggressive bidding, especially when my value is high, to gather data on competitors' behaviors. I'll vary my bids around 70-90% of my value to test their responses. If my value is low, I'll place minimal bids to conserve resources and observe others. Mid-game, I'll adjust strategies based on patterns, potentially using bluffing tactics when values are moderate. In later rounds, I'll refine my approach to maximize profit by leveraging insights gained, balancing aggression with caution based on observed bidding trends and competitors' risk tolerance.

To maximize long-term profit, I'll adopt a dynamic bidding strategy. Initially, I'll bid conservatively, around 60-70% of my value, to gather data on Andy's and Betty's bidding patterns. If my value exceeds 30, I'll test aggressive bids at 80-90% to assess their risk tolerance. I'll also experiment with bluffing by occasionally bidding slightly above my value when it's low to test their response. Throughout, I'll adjust based on observed patterns, identifying if they consistently bid high or low, and adapt by undercutting or outbidding them strategically. This approach balances data collection with profit maximization.

Test incremental bid increases when value is high, targeting slightly above competitors' average bids. Occasionally bid low to identify minimum thresholds. Monitor Betty's and Charles's patterns, adjusting bids to undercut their peaks. Prioritize high-value wins with minimal cost, refining strategies based on observed risk tolerance and bidding trends.

Next, I'll bid 80-90% of my value if high, to test competitors' limits. For low values, bid minimally to conserve profits. Mid-game, observe patterns for strategic bluffs. Later, adjust based on insights, balancing aggression and caution to optimize profit against competitors' risk profiles.

In the next rounds, I'll bid 70% of my value if it's below 25. If my value exceeds 25, I'll bid 85% to test aggressiveness. Occasionally, I'll bid slightly above my value to bluff. Continuously adjust based on Andy's and Betty's patterns to optimize profit.
